question.text: It is imperative that computer passwords ___ kept confidential.
The president of Paterson Industrial Soiutions has signed a number of important ___ this month.

answer.explanation: The answer comes after an adjective so we use a noun. There is "a number of" so we use the noun in its plural form.

question.text: Sitting through long presentations can make the audience ___ , so speakers should limit their talks to 30 minutes.
Mr. Song's promotion to the position of division ___ was announced at this morning's staff meeting.

answer.explanation: The answer comes after a noun so it is a noun, as a part of a noun phrase.

question.text: Insurance specialists at Datweiler & Associates receive three months of intensive training ___ they begin working with clients.

answer.explanation: We connect a clause with a clause that will happen later by the preposition "before".

question.text: The use of umbrellas is prohibited in the sports stadium because they obstruct the view of  ___.
To be ___ for the position at Prextile Industries, candidates must have at least two years of engineering experience.

answer.explanation:
Consider sb for a position
"Apply" and "work" also go with for, but only in active voice.

question.text: The price of all cruises___airfare and all transfers.

answer.explanation: (B) This agrees with the singular subject “price”. Choices (A), (C), and (D) are all plural.

question.text: Mr. Brett missed the plane___he was working late.

answer.explanation: (C) “Because” indicates a cause-and-effect relationship. Choices (A), (B), and (D) are not logical.

question.text: Many customers have requested that we___them notice of our sales.

answer.explanation: (A) The causative verb “request” is followed by a base form verb. Choice (B) is present tense. Choice (C) is past tense. Choice (D) is a gerund.
